intro: Gomesa divaricata, commonly known as the variable gomesia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically tubular and come in shades of pink or purple, often clustered in inflorescences. Gomesa divaricata is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
